snippet: A jury has failed to decide whether a former postal worker was legally sane in 1993 when he killed his mother, then went to a post office and shot a former co-worker to death.    A mistrial was declared on Monday in the sanity phase of the trial f...
lead_paragraph: A jury has failed to decide whether a former postal worker was legally sane in 1993 when he killed his mother, then went to a post office and shot a former co-worker to death. A mistrial was declared on Monday in the sanity phase of the trial for the man, Mark Richard Hilbun, who was convicted in August of murder, attempted murder and other felonies. He had pleaded not guilty by reason of insanity to all charges.
abstract: Santa Ana, Calif, jury fails to reach verdict over whether former postal worker Mark Richard Hilbun was legally sane in 1993 when he shot and killed mother and co-worker (S)
